user.title: Set up Splunk HTTP Event Collector
user.description: Enter your Splunk HTTP Event Collector (HEC) connection details. You can find the token in your Splunk server under Settings > Data Inputs > HTTP Event Collector.

data_description.token: The HEC token configured in your Splunk instance
data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of your Splunk server
data_description.port: The port number for the HTTP Event Collector (usually 8088)
data_description.ssl: Enable if your Splunk server uses HTTPS
data_description.verify_ssl: Verify the SSL certificate when connecting (recommended)
data_description.name: A name to identify this Home Assistant instance in Splunk events

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate Splunk
reauth_confirm.description: The Splunk token is no longer valid. Please enter a new HTTP Event Collector token.

error.cannot_connect: Unable to connect to the Splunk server. Please verify the host, port, and SSL settings are correct.
error.invalid_auth: The HTTP Event Collector token is invalid. Please verify the token is correct and enabled in your Splunk server.
error.invalid_config: Failed to import YAML configuration. Please check your configuration.yaml file.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Please check the logs for more details.

abort.already_configured: This Splunk server is already configured.
abort.invalid_config: The YAML configuration is invalid and cannot be imported. Please check your configuration.yaml file and set up Splunk through the UI instead.

deprecated_yaml.title: Splunk YAML configuration is being imported to the UI
deprecated_yaml.description:
Configuring Splunk using YAML is being removed.

Your YAML configuration has been imported into the UI automatically.

Remove the `splunk` configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

For more information, see the [documentation]({documentation_url}).

deprecated_yaml_with_filter.title: Splunk YAML configuration with entity filter is deprecated
deprecated_yaml_with_filter.description:
Configuring Splunk using YAML is being removed. However, your configuration includes an entity filter, which is not supported in the UI configuration.

Your current YAML configuration will continue to work, but you should plan to migrate to the UI configuration and implement filtering using automations or other Home Assistant features instead.

If you remove the entity filter from your YAML configuration, it will be automatically imported to the UI.

For more information, see the [documentation]({documentation_url}).
